page.title: 11ARCHAEOLOGY IN STAFFORD 1985
page.content: The centre of Stafford is to be redeveloped and this gave an opportunity for an archaeological dig on four main sites in Stafford. The Â£digs' were completed last year and last month we visited an exhibition of the Â£finds' which was held in the Art Gallery over Stafford Library. We travelled by the latest thing in Stafford,the minibus, to see the oldest finds. The oldest things we saw were Roman coins and a few potsherds. Then there were medieval coins, a bone comb and the remains of three large bread ovens. The most popular exhibit was a skeleton found in the dig near St.Mary's Church,it had rotten teeth, a hole in its jawbone caused by an abscess and severe arthritis! We were given paper and allowed to draw the things we found most interesting.
